anecdotes.title: MIT
anecdotes.body: She grew up in the Midwest Indiana Ohio Michigan Upper Penninsula, USA. In 1958, she received her undergraduate degree in mathematics and worked as a programmer at MIT.

anecdotes.title: NASA
anecdotes.body: She was the first programmer hired by NASA and worked on MITâ€™s Apollo project: landing a man on the moon.

anecdotes.title: Human Error
anecdotes.body: One of her key contributions was to add code to the Apollo flight Software to account for human error.  This code stopped a system overload when a crew member set a switch in the wrong position. The software handled the error as intended, and the astronauts successfully landed on the moon.

anecdotes.title: Awards
anecdotes.body: She was awarded the NASA Exceptional Space Act Award for her scientific and technical contributions. She was chosen as a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom by USA President Barack Obama.
